alert.note: Alert for Durham; Franklin; Granville; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 3:57PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Granville, northern Wake, southeastern Durham and Franklin Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 356 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Wake Forest, or 9 miles south of Creedmoor, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Durham, Louisburg, Wake Forest, Franklinton, Bunn, Rolesville, Youngsville, Centerville and Falls Lake State Rec Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for central North Carolina.
